text: We went here for lunch a couple of weeks ago on a Saturday, and I was thoroughly impressed with the food.
Try the Times Square cocktail -- ginger lemonade with vodka (also available without vodka.)
The steak was excellent and one of the best I have had (I tasted the butter intitally but in no way did it overwhelm the flavor of the meat).
Cozy romantic atomosphere with only around 15 tables at most.
Yes, they use fancy ingredients, but even fancy ingredients don't make for good pizza unless someone knows how to get the crust right.
Once I removed all the software the laptop loads in 15-20 seconds.
They even have a section in the menu called American Chinese food!
(Beware, their staff could send you back making you feel that only they know what a computer is.
It can be a little confusing as to where one goes to order, but once the food is ordered, you are in for a treat.
Just bring someone who speaks Cantonese because waiter may not understand you.
Also, the sandwiches (nearing $7) didn't come with anything like chips or a side.
Three page wine menu, one page entree and horedevous.
For all of you new to Indian food, try the Paneer Roll, it is a piece of heaven.
I never had this kind of quality issue with Dell (not to say Dell is that great), not with a brand new laptop.
Just don't take the seat between the bar and the back half of the restaurant, i saw a woman get nudged 40times sitting there.
